column4: So I'm in a weird situation. I'm on a Windows network with completely screwed up DNS tables and I'm trying to find the IP of another Ubuntu box on the network. Out of 2,000 clients, there's only 5 Linux boxes on the network. Is there any way I can "scoop" up the clients that are Linux based and not Windows based so I can probe each one to find which is the file server I need?
You might want to check out Spiceworks.  We use it at my office and it's amazing how much information it can tell you about the machines on your network.
thanks, gonna look into that now
